item.title: Heartopia: How to Play With Friends
item.description:
Players will become acquainted with various villagers in Heartopia . While it's lovely to be able to talk to the townsfolk, players might want to add their real-life friends and have a play session in-game.

It's a hoot to play Heartopia on call with a friend or even right beside them, so it's important that players understand the steps that they need to take in order to initiate a multiplayer session. This guide will show players how they can add friends in Heartopia , how to start a play session with them, and even how to become best friends.

How to Add Friends in Heartopia

To add a friend in Heartopia , players need their D.G. Member UID, which is a code that directly links to their profile. Gamers can find their D.G. Member UID in the bottom left corner of their screen or by opening the Smartwatch and selecting their portrait.

Once players have their friend's D.G. Member UID, they must open the Friendship Journal app on their phone, select the magnifying glass symbol on the bottom left, and type in the code.

How to Become Best Friends in Heartopia

When players use 2-person interactions with a friend, they will receive Friendship Marks. The more marks they accumulate, the higher their Friendship Level. At some point, the two players will reach a status of Best Friends.

Players should visit Annie in the Central Square and get some items from her Friendshop Store so they can start leveling up their friendships in Heartopia .

How to Play with Friends in Heartopia

Once the player has added their friend in Heartopia , they will find them in the Friendship Notebook's friends tab. To start a multiplayer session in Heartopia , gamers have to select a friend who is online and then click on Visit . This puts them in the same public server as their friend, meaning they will see 10 other players in the neighborhood.

They can speak by using the Chat tool in the bottom left corner, and they can use emoticons and emote by selecting the smiley face on the right part of the screen.

Alternatively, instead of visiting a friend, players can create their own town or join a friend's. From the title screen, gamers can select the windmill symbol to access the Town menu. When players create a town in Heartopia , they're given a private server, which can be available for 1 to 24 hours.

Subscribe to the newsletter for Heartopia friend tips

Unlock deeper Heartopia multiplayer insights—subscribe to the newsletter for advanced tips, strategy breakdowns, and practical social guides that expand on what you already know and help sharpen your play.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

To maintain a private town, players must pay 5 Moonlight Crystals per hour. After the first 24 hours, it will cost Heart Diamonds instead. This timer resets on a weekly basis.

Heartopia

item.title: 8 Non-Open-World Games That Still Give You Total Freedom
item.description:
Open-world games obviously have more open design choices, whereas the rest of the video game genres could be considered non-open-world games. That said, the following games do have exploration options that compare to open-world games, whether that’s in a sandbox or an interactive world map.

Even though they are smaller in scope, these games do still have a lot of options that will give players a nice sense of freedom while playing, perhaps even more so than true open-world games. This might include everything from dialogue options to town-building segments. For anyone looking for a smaller adventure with a lot to do, these are the games to check out.

Baldur's Gate 3

Nothing But Choice

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

Baldur's Gate 3 is the ultimate example of a game that offers a wealth of content upfront, as each chapter provides players with a vast environment to explore at their leisure, albeit from an isometric perspective. Players can create their character, including their looks, race, and class.

As they travel, they will meet various party members and decide who to include in the game's complex tactical battles, who to sideline, and who to start romances with. Best of all, their story choices will make every playthrough unique. It’s a game well worth revisiting, as the choices and variety of outcomes in all regards are absolutely staggering for a Dungeons & Dragons video game.

Mass Effect

The Galaxy Is Yours

Mass Effect
Released
November 20, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
BioWare
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Mass Effect feels massive, as players can explore various planets, although they're typically confined to one location, and some moons can be researched via a buggy called the Mako. Still, the variety and optional content will make players feel like they are truly exploring the galaxy with their party. Players can customize their character and choose a class in this RPG as well, but their race will always be human.

There are dialogue choices that can offer good and bad decisions, which will affect character relationships, including romances, and in some major instances, the story. Players can choose who to bring on their missions, and they can give orders during combat, as the game is technically a squad-based cover shooter with an RPG tinge.

Ni No Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom

Reclaim Your Honor

Ni No Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom
Released
March 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Level 5
Genre(s)
JRPG
Powered by

Ni no Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom features a world map to explore between major dungeons and town locations, just like old-school RPGs from the SNES and PS1 days. In combat, everything plays out in real time, making for quick battles provided players have a good grasp of the controls. Also on the world map, players can fight RTS-like battles to recapture stolen territories.

The story follows Evan, a young prince who lost his kingdom. While they fight to reclaim it, players can build a new castle and an accompanying town for Evan and his companions, and managing properties can earn players various bonuses.

Monster Hunter World

Hunt Or Be Hunted

Monster Hunter World
10 /10
Released
January 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Monster Hunter World , despite the name, is not an open-world experience, but it does get rid of the segmented zones from the previous Monster Hunter games, which makes hunts and exploration more enjoyable for all. At the start, players can create their character and their Palico cat companion, and then further customize their gear loadout by crafting after a successful hunting mission using the materials they acquired.

There are no set classes, but weapons serve as class-like builds, from using a bow to a giant sword. Hunts are best played with three others online to find wider success, as these beasties mean trouble even with the greatest set of gear available in this action RPG.

Dave The Diver

Become The Best Sushi Chef

Dave the Diver
Released
June 28, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Mintrocket
Genre(s)
Simulation, Adventure
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Dave the Diver is a mishmash of genres, one that many players have found soothing as an indie game. The titular Dave is hired to help run a sushi restaurant. Dave is in charge of orders and drinks while his chef prepares the food during dinner time, and in this segment, players have to make sure all their guests are happy.

The main crux of the game is deep-sea diving, wherein players must actually catch the fish they're serving at the restaurant. Gaining money helps unlock new gear to catch fish in various ways. The whole gameplay loop is a masterclass in how a small game can turn into something deeply enjoyable when the right development team is allowed to stretch their creative legs.

Dragon Quest 9: Sentinels Of The Starry Sky

Party Up

Dragon Quest IX: Sentinels of the Starry Skies
JRPG
Systems
9 /10
Released
July 15, 2009
ESRB
t

Developer(s)
Level 5, Square Enix
Genre(s)
JRPG
Powered by

Dragon Quest 9: Sentinels of the Starry Sky is a big change-up for the series, as it was the first mainline Dragon Quest game to be released on a portable console, the DS. It lets players customize their character initially, and then after the tutorial area, players can create their party of up to three more characters.

A class system is also unlocked, called Vocations, and players can create powerful parties by mastering Vocations and swapping skills. If they don't want to play alone, then they can also play with three others via their connected DS systems. Online functionality at the time of release also let players share maps to explore. It was a very forward-thinking game on the DS, and these ideas later evolved on the 3DS with functions like StreetPass and SpotPass.

Dark Cloud 2

Time Is On Your Side

Dark Cloud 2
Released
February 17, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Developer(s)
Level-5
Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Dark Cloud 2 is a time-traveling RPG featuring two central characters, Max and Monica, who are trying to fix the timeline. Each area they visit is devoid of life, so they must go into dungeons to get materials to then free villagers from their fate, along with rebuilding the town however the player wants.

Deeper picks on exploration-driven games — subscribe

Subscribing to our newsletter brings curated recommendations, deep dives, and tailored analysis of games that capture open-world freedom in compact experiences. Get expert picks and context to help you find your next exploration-rich adventure.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Besides hacking and slashing at enemies in dungeons, players can also fish and golf once an area is cleared. Max also has a camera to take pictures, which he can then use for crafting. For a fairly linear game, Dark Cloud 2 gives players a lot to do on the PS2 thanks to Level-5 giving it their all.

Fantasy Life (3DS)

Live Your Life

Fantasy Life
Released
October 24, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Comic Mischief, Fantasy Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Level-5
Genre(s)
RPG, Life Simulation
Powered by

Fantasy Life is another Level-5 game, but this one is much smaller and was seemingly created as a way for everyone to check out an RPG for the first time. Players can create their character and then choose a class called a Life at the start, which comes in three categories: Combat, Gathering, and Crafting. Players can do the normal action RPG gameplay loop by attacking enemies as a Magician, for example, to level up.

They can also go fishing or chop down trees as an Angler or Woodcutter to level up. No one Life locks players out of other content, and it actually encourages players to check out everything the game has to offer. Switching between manic and relaxing Lives gives players a better sense of pace, as well as more activities to do, and while this game is a bit inaccessible, as it is exclusive to the 3DS, the sequel, Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time , is more accessible on modern hardware.

item.title: New Farming Sim on Steam Looks Like Next-Gen Stardew Valley, Animal Crossing
item.description:
The farming sim formula is no longer rare. Over the past decade, games inspired by Stardew Valley have flooded Steam with familiar rhythms: arriving in a small town, tending crops, befriending neighbors, and settling into a predictable but comforting loop. It’s cozy, reliable, but also increasingly difficult to reinvent. Yet every so often, a new title doesn’t just remix that formula; it reimagines what it could look like with modern scale, presentation, and freedom. Starsand Island is one such game.

Set to release in Q1 2026, this upcoming farming and life sim takes the emotional core of Stardew Valley and the lifestyle fantasy of Animal Crossing , then expands both into a fully explorable island paradise that feels designed for a new generation of cozy players. Rather than shrinking its world down to bite-sized routines, Starsand Island leans into openness, movement, and environmental immersion. It achieves this while maintaining the slow, pastoral fantasy completely intact. Starsand Island invites players to leave behind urban life and rediscover something quieter: a coastal utopia where farming, exploration, and community exist side by side.

Starsand Island’s Core Features at a Glance

  • A fully explorable island with beaches, forests, ruins, and neighboring islands
  • Tropical farming and animal care , including capybaras, cats, and dogs
  • Multiple traversal options , from longboards and scooters to boats
  • Deep customization , allowing players to design terraced farms and countryside villas
  • Social systems focused on friendships, romance, and community storytelling

Starsand Island’s Cozy Fantasy Is Built Around Escape and Freedom

Tired of the city grind? Escape to Starsand Island and embrace a peaceful, Chinese-inspired pastoral life. (...) Find your quiet seaside retreat and rediscover life's simple joys.

Starsand Island describes itself as a retreat from the modern grind, and that philosophy is embedded directly into its design. Players arrive on a lush island known in-game as the “Star of the Deep Sea,” where daily life unfolds at a gentle pace, though never dull. Farming tropical fruits, fishing along the coast, bonding with animals, and wandering through misty forests aren’t just side activities. They are the point of the Starsand Island experience.

Unlike many farming sims that confine players to tight maps and rigid schedules, Starsand Island' s features emphasize freedom of movement and scale. Players aren’t limited to their homestead, walking everywhere, warping between zones, or even staying on the same island. Instead, the island encourages exploration as a lifestyle. This approach makes Starsand Island feel less like managing a checklist and more like inhabiting a real digital place.

In this sense, Starsand Island takes deep inspiration from the daily options Animal Crossing players enjoy. Not every day needs to look the same, and Starsand knows it.

A Living Island That Blends Stardew Valley’s Routine With Animal Crossing’s Vibe

At its heart, Starsand Island borrows heavily from Stardew Valley ’s sense of daily structure: planting crops, caring for animals, and building relationships. But it also embraces the softer, lifestyle-driven tone that Animal Crossing popularized. There’s no looming pressure to optimize every day or race against a clock. Instead, the game encourages players to slow down and live alongside the island’s rhythms.

A Dynamic NPC Affection System That Improves Upon Stardew's Romances and Friendships

Each resident has their own story, and relationships deepen through daily interactions and special quests. As bonds grow, players can form friendships or pursue romance in Starsand Island . It gives the island a sense of continuity and emotional payoff over time. Yet, Starsand Island doesn’t stop at cozy social loops.

Starsand Island ’s NPC Affection System isn’t a traditional “raise a heart meter and unlock romance” mechanic. Instead, it’s built around subtle, reactive relationships that evolve over time. Often, without the player realizing it’s happening.

  • Affection is personality-driven, not universal: Every NPC reacts differently based on who they are. Getting closer isn’t about repeating the same actions across characters, but about learning each character's preferences, routines, and emotional boundaries.
  • NPCs respond to presence and absence: Show up consistently and remember what matters to them, and NPCs visibly brighten. Disappear for too long, and they might grow distant or quietly disappointed. These emotional shifts aren’t scripted cutscenes, but organic changes in tone, behavior, and interaction.
  • Affection goes both ways: As bonds deepen, Starsand Island 's NPCs may take the initiative themselves. They might surprise you with personalized gifts, invite you to spend time together, or share quiet moments.
  • Every affection path is unique and intertwined: NPC storylines can be romantic or platonic, and your choices shape how they unfold. Who you spend holidays with, which gifts you give, and how you respond in key moments can influence not only individual relationships, but the wider social fabric of the island.

Rather than treating villagers as static quest-givers or romance checklists, Starsand Island positions its NPCs as active participants in your island life. They grow, change, and remember—turning everyday moments into lasting emotional payoffs.

Starsand Island Isn’t Afraid to Get Mysterious, Either

Beneath its tranquil surface, Starsand Island is a game with mysterious secrets. Fog-covered ruins, rare minerals, and strange creatures await players willing to venture beyond the safety of their farms. Combat and exploration elements introduce light danger, creating contrast without overwhelming the game’s relaxed tone. Rather than transforming into a survival game, Starsand Island uses mystery as a way to add texture to its world. And it gives players something to uncover alongside their peaceful routines.

A Next-Gen Take on a Familiar Comfort

Starsand Island doesn’t try to replace Stardew Valley or Animal Crossing . Instead, it builds on what players already love about those games and asks what that fantasy looks like with modern scope, traversal, and environmental design. By emphasizing freedom, exploration, and immersion, it offers a farming sim experience that feels expansive without losing its heart. For players craving a cozy game that feels less confined and more like a true escape, Starsand Island may be one of 2026’s most promising games.

item.title: Why the Rumored LEGO Architecture Record‑Breaker Could Be the Most Ambitious Build of 2026
item.description:
This year is shaping up to be a big one for LEGO . So far, plenty of rumors have come out about what sets should be expected in 2026. From major pop culture franchises to long-running LEGO brand staples, the rumored upcoming sets are expected to cover a lot of ground. Some of the expected sets include popular IP like Jurassic World , Animal Crossing , Super Mario , and Fortnite , but that's merely the tip of the iceberg. When it comes to LEGO's in-house collections, there is even more in store.

Botanicals, Art, and Icons all have both confirmed and rumored sets on the way, but one of the most compelling collections at the moment is Architecture. Right now, there are two confirmed sets and two yet-to-be-revealed ones. The latter could prove to be a major moment for LEGO, if rumors are true. According to Brick Fanatics, one of these unnamed sets could break the LEGO piece-count record, making it a set that collectors are going to want to keep a close eye on. LEGO's 2026 release calendar is already stellar, but the Architecture collection may prove to be the star this year.

LEGO's Architecture Collection is Rumored to Include a Set That Has a Jaw-Dropping Number of Pieces

Brick Fanatics doesn't have much information to reveal about the two mystery Architecture sets, but one is expected to be the largest set in LEGO history. According to Brick Fanatics' inside information, one of the sets is reported to have a whopping 12,000 pieces. LEGO has made several sets that have been incredibly large, but this Architecture set would definitely be in first place if Brick Fanatics is accurate. The recently leaked Minas Tirith LEGO set is claimed to have around 8,000 pieces, which is impressive enough. But, the 12,000-piece set is pretty mind-blowing, and it will likely take the spotlight as one of the year's most exciting releases.

The Top 5 Biggest LEGO Sets to Date

Set Name

Number of Pieces

Price

LEGO Art World Map

11,695

No longer available for purchase

LEGO Icons Eiffel Tower

10,001

$629.99 USD

LEGO Icons Titanic

9,090

$679.99 USD

LEGO Colosseum

9,036

No longer available for purchase

LEGO Star Wars Death Star

9,023

$999.99 USD

Just to really drive home just how big of a set this could be, these are currently the biggest LEGO sets ever made. The LEGO Art World Map comes a little close to the rumored Architecture set's 12,000 pieces, but the latter is still ahead by 305 pieces. It's hard to imagine a 12,000-piece set. The LEGO Art World Map was already huge, so there's no telling how daunting the Architecture set could be. It may sound intimidating, but that's also why it's so exciting.

Excluding the LEGO Art World Map, every set on the above list is also among the most expensive LEGO builds.

The 12,000-Piece LEGO Set Will Be a Must-Buy for Architecture Fans and Collectors

If Brick Fanatics is accurate, this wouldn't just be a huge moment for Architecture die-hards, but LEGO fans in general. Such a massive set is bound to draw a lot of attention from collectors, even if they haven't necessarily been invested in the Architecture collections in the past. LEGO fans from many corners of the community will have the ideal set to bring their collection to the next level. However, the growing price of LEGO sets could force collectors to fork over some serious cash.

A LEGO Set With 12,000 Pieces Also Might Mean a Big Price Tag to Match

There's one big question looming over LEGO fans' heads: How much will it cost? There are plenty of pricey LEGO sets out there, but the rumored Architecture build could potentially be one of the most expensive yet. That'll be another record-breaking detail for the set, but it'll also make it a bit controversial, too. Some sets from the Architecture collection are already on the list of most expensive LEGO sets. This set will likely be the new must-have item regardless of price, but that's also dependent on what the subject of the set will be. Considering the size of the build, LEGO is likely saving its biggest piece ever for something that would make heads turn. It'll almost definitely be some kind of globally recognized monument. However, that's about all that can be deduced about it until LEGO makes an actual announcement.

There's still the possibility that the price won't be too over-the-top, though. The LEGO Art World Map may boast the most pieces, but it launched with a $200 price tag. Since being discontinued, it now costs much more on secondary markets, though.

Rumors about LEGO's 2026 plans have already generated a lot of hype, so this Architecture piece is hopefully worth the excitement. It's really hard to imagine a scenario where LEGO would use a 12,000-piece set for something underwhelming, though. It's unclear when LEGO will finally reveal what this mysterious set is, but it'll hopefully be soon.

Confirmed LEGO Architecture Sets for 2026

  • Paris — City of Love (Available now)
  • Tower Bridge (Release date: TBA)

Paris — City of Love is the cheapest LEGO Architecture set since 2022. It currently costs $79.99 USD.

LEGO is Bringing Exciting Things to a Wide Variety of Fans This Year

Whether you're a LEGO fan who loves Marvel and DC or are more interested in collections like Botanicals and Ideas, the toy company is covering as many bases as possible. There's even speculation that new SpongeBob SquarePants LEGO sets could be in the works after AREA-X Bricks discontinued its line based on the franchise. This is purely a theory at the moment, but it would definitely add even more for LEGO fans to be excited about in 2026.

Subscribe for expert LEGO coverage and Architecture insights

Curious about LEGO's biggest rumored releases? Subscribe to the newsletter for focused coverage, in-depth context, and thoughtful analysis on major sets — from Architecture record-breakers to highlights across LEGO's expansive lineup.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Between the recent reveal of the LEGO Smart Brick and the wild number of planned and rumored sets, LEGO is aiming to generate a lot of hype about its upcoming lineup. Right now, the Architecture set is still being kept hidden at the moment. When LEGO finally makes a reveal, though, it's going to be really exciting to see what exactly this set has to offer.

item.title: Where to get Prism Herb in StarRupture
item.description:
Prism Herb is one of the critical components of many useful consumables in StarRupture, and players will need lots of them to unlock crafting recipes and break into the endgame of this incredible survival builder. But this rare plant is a bit hard to find, and with the devastating Rupture Waves happening every few minutes, it gets really difficult to farm them.

Luckily, we've pinpointed the location of a decent farming spot for these plants, to help players get enough of these crafting materials to unlock everything in their Food Station. Craft the ultimate consumables to resist every major hazard in Arcadia-7 with this step-by-step guide on how to get Prism Herbs in StarRupture.

Prism Herb Location in StarRupture

Prism Herb is a plant that looks like lavender , and usually grows near water ponds (like Hydrobulbs). Players can identify them by their purplish-blue color and the colorful butterfly-like bugs that swarm around them .

The locations of these plants are often related to mid/late game zones, especially those marked as prime sites to build bases, like the Mid-Eastern zone of Arcadia-7 or The Reach. It grows near the middle of the map in ponds or near rivers, but far away from zones with high concentrations of Vermin and radiation.

There's a pond near a hill in the eastern zone of the map, going to the right from the Orbital Lander (first spawn zone). If players continue going straight past the Abandoned Settlement, they will reach a high-ground area (hills) and then a plateau. Past the plateau, there are various critical resources, including Quartz, Sulfur, Pure Titanium, Wolfram, and Helium-3.

But the most important part of this area is the Pond in the middle, which has lots of Hydrobulbs to farm and a small island in the middle of it with lots of Prism Herbs.

Remember that all plant life in Arcadia-7 is incinerated when a Rupture Wave happens. Players need to wait between waves to farm plants in StarRupture, since everything grows back really fast after the planet returns to normal. Waves are set to happen periodically at random, so there's no exact way to know when one hits. If this happens when players are away from their base, they can quickly farm a Meteorite and build a small base to protect themselves.

Prism Herbs are required to unlock the recipes for:

  • Calorie Chew (Restores 40 Calories)
  • Aqua Chew (Restores 100 Hydration)
  • Nutri Chew (Restores 30 Calories and 40 Hydration)
  • Energy Boost Chew (Triples Energy Regeneration. Adds 40 Toxicity).
  • Infection Res Plasm (Doubles Infection Resistance for 10 minutes. Adds 40 Toxicity).

Players will need around 200 Prism Herbs to unlock all of these recipes, plus more to craft these consumables. The Infection Res Plasm and Energy Boost Chew are especially useful to fight against swarms of Vermin. Players can buff themselves with these consumables to jump into a swarm of these vile creatures and farm their Biofacts , biological samples that they can pick up and deliver to the Analysis Station to farm Data Points.
